Dear Patrick

Yes indeed - one of the Namban group and probably made by a c=
asting 
process in the early-mid C19.  This group is characterised by its 
=
openwork and undercutting; the common presence of affronted dragons 
with t=
he tama jewel; and the atypically shaped seppa-dai.  All of 
these are pres=
ent on your tsuba.

I would have expected a tsuba of this type to be of iro=
n, but some 
were cast in bronze.  Interestingly these are unexpectedly att=
racted 
by a magnet, but the admixture of up to 30% of iron to bronze in 
o=
rder to reduce the cost of the expensive alloy was not unknown.  
Also, iro=
n was a common inclusion in naturally occurring copper ore 

Regards, John =
L.
